oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Confederate veteran James Calvin Carnahan and his family
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Carnahan, Co. G, 8th Tenn. (Smith's) Cav. Regt., CSA, fought at Perryville, Chickamauga, Murfreesboro, Missionary Ridge, and served under Capt. J. N. Nichols and Col. Baxter Smith. His pension application indicates that he was imprisoned in Lousiville, Ky. for six weeks and paroled in North Carolina in 1865. His service record indicates that he was paroled in Louisville and sent to Ohio in 1864 upon taking the oath of allegiance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Carnahan, James Calvin;McGill, Elizabeth;Lula, A.L.;Carnahan, Seamus
